comment.body: Also "Not found"

In the [video here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/1549142235), the researchers showed that the URL for a Google translation contains the entire text you want translated, and how they used that to identify people and what they were communicating.
Also, here's a [brief ZeroTalk post about offline translation](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1548909076_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE)
Was there an audio option? Sometimes that can be a different way to get past recaptchas.

What do you like about the design?
-
Apart from the colours (I prefer dark theme), the only real difference I notice is the text box on the right, and the menu of (external) links on the left. Which to me is the problem with much Chinese website design: like portal websites from the 1990s, they try to cram as many links as humanly possible onto the page. (This site "only" has 33 links there :)
-
Oh wait, there's also a header image. That's a nice option.
Sorry! I didn't realize because I have a browser extension to prevent that. I cut out the `autoplay=""` code. How about now?

@caryoscelus: When I tried the subs,
1. they never showed on screen
2. each option I chose subsequently disappeared from the Captions menu.

Tested again just now and the same happens. Using Vivaldi (Chromium-based).

Works now :)
ya una *década* y aún no salió la pinche [secuela](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avatar_(2009_film%29#Sequels). ¡de las *cuatro* secuelas!

Poverty (e.g. GDP per capita or purchasing power parity) and inequality (e.g. Gini coefficient) are two different things. Both are bad, in different ways, so ideally both should be reduced.
-
Over the last 4 decades, mainland China has seen a huge decrease in the percentage of people suffering absolute poverty (good), while also seeing a big increase in inequality (bad). And most of the usual societal outlets to reduce inequality (e.g. complaints in media, votes in elections) are repressed/controlled/non-existent, so there's little prospect of peaceful resolution of inequality (bad).
-
Ironically, ***non***-Communist China (a.k.a. Free China, a.k.a. the Republic of China, a.k.a Taiwan) has long had much *less* inequality (Gini in 2017: 33.7) than the proletarian paradise of the People's Republic (Gini in 2017: 46.7). Here's a thesis about the disparity:
+ [FAST ECONOMIC GROWTH WITH
HIGH INEQUALITY: WHY IS
MAINLAND CHINA DIFFERENT FROM
TAIWAN, CHINA?](http://lup.lub.lu.se/luur/download?func=downloadFile&recordOId=1433625&fileOId=1433644)

Cool find! Especially handy for folks like me who don't have photoshopping skills but want to play around with images.

Word of warning to anyone interested in this:
+ doesn't accept WebP
+ might take a minute, be patient
+ "Medium download" is not available without signup, despite the Download menu implying that signup is only necessary for "HD download".

Now I just need to learn how to use layers in an image editor so I can put in a different background :)
I see now the "Edit" button on remove.bg is for inserting a background image, but the results were better in my offline image editor, where I could adjust size and position.
Interesting. I wonder what this means.
Very rarely. Depends on poster (and file size). Maybe if it has some likes already.

I recently created a vanitygen address for [The Papers](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Papers8S7fe6LEsa7BwVVywWVbMpUjgwx/) and while this guide was useful, it's also problematic (e.g. partly out-of-date). I ought to post a new guide (if there isn't another one somewhere already).

@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: I'm in the middle of writing the post, trying to remember all the details, but basically it was the part about getting your site to use the address, which contained some unclear/ambiguous instructions that (I *think*, I'm not an expert) are also out of date because of changes to the site sidebar, e.g. there are now buttons there to sign the site.
Will probably complete and publish post later today.

@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: PS just realized that link is, I think, a clone of the original here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/13x71nc7fju6afMqpEPfcu3Gx9Z5hNhH48/?Post:5:How+To:+custom+ZeroNet+addresses+using+Vanitygen+

Here's my post:
+ [Getting a vanity address for a zite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ctjcvfovq6d1JWEGvM1JovCym4H6Es33L/?Post:26:Getting+a+vanity+address+for+a+zite)

[You are late to the game](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1White24UrrwQrD86o6Vrc1apgZ1x1o51/13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE/1554823066). And how ***dare*** you call it [drama](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Profile/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/)?! You thinK poor, brave viktims kourageously and righteously kalling out [the shitty behaviour they suffer wherever they find it](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/1Fnk5S9aU2kCvTFtYMWosbE9NFaRjgeemo/1555930698) is all just *drama*? The real faktor all these incidents share, the kommon denominator if you will, is obviously not drama, it's... that it's all the rest of us here who are jerKs. And if you can't see that, then *you're* a jerK too. With a capital ~~K~~ J! I can't wait either until it's your turn and some poor brave heroic victim steps up and brings you the **pain**! The pain of **the truth** about *your* shitty behaviour here!
.
So I don't want to talk to you no more, you empty headed animal food trough wiper. I **fart** in your general direction. Your mother was a hamster and your father smelt of elderberries.

---
How was that? OK? :)
@caryoscelus: well, if it was better than OK, that's probably [due to Monty Python](https://en.wikiquote.org/wiki/Monty_Python_and_the_Holy_Grail#French_taunts).
@caryoscelus: Oh no, now I've been a jerk. Thank you for bravely calling me out on it!

> I'm just curious... what do you call this?

I don't *need* to call it anything; I know *you*'ll call it something. And whatever that something is, I know it'll be pure, uncut ***TRUTH***!

> + Klu9... Deliberately lying about me.

Admittedly I did fail to confess to and list the many terrible lies I have made up about you. No doubt you'll remedy my clearly malicious oversight for us? And perhaps give us the links so everyone can see these deliberate lies for themselves?
.
But honestly, I don't understand why you're bothered by what I wrote here: all I did was give links to *your* own words and give *your* own characterization of our interactions. Surely you should be *happy* that people can see for themselves what a big meanie I was to you, your suffering at my hands, and your brave resistance in the face of such atrocities.
.
For example, some lesser individual, some **coward**, would have let my answer to the question ["Hi I am looking for a site where can](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/1Fnk5S9aU2kCvTFtYMWosbE9NFaRjgeemo/1555930698) [present tense] [get movies](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/1Fnk5S9aU2kCvTFtYMWosbE9NFaRjgeemo/1555930698) [plural][?"](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/1Fnk5S9aU2kCvTFtYMWosbE9NFaRjgeemo/1555930698) slide, or just given some mealy-mouthed cop-out like "*There's also KxoVid and ShareTube, which don't have much content yet but hopefully will have more in the future.*"
.
Some **weakling** like that might have wimped out and preferred to tell themselves that I hadn't mentioned KxoVid and Sharetube in my answer because the last time I had checked those sites before writing that answer, Sharetube had only three videos total and no movies (unless one considers the Christchurch massacre video a movie) and KxoVid's Movies & TV category had just four videos (three of them not movies).
.
Only someone with unwavering courage and laser-like perception would see through my charade of a seemingly helpful response and call it out for what it *really* was, clearly a personal attack by me on you, and thus respond in kind and make half their answer "*- of course, klu9 already knew that, but chose not to tell you this (which is a deliberate disservice to you, imo - but of course he probably didn't like that I told him off for being a jerk, lol).*" (oh, and make the other half of their answer the availability of things that are, umm, **not** movies).
. 
Only someone with admirable moral rectitude would have issued a devastating takedown of my awful and misleading attack, and taken some newb's simple request for info and, instead of merely answering it, turn it into a battlefield in your brave war against jerks like me. Just like the brave heroes in the movie *300*. You know *300*, right? It's the movie [singular] available on KxoVid (and, while I can understand why its name might confuse, is still actually just *one* movie [singular], and not, you know, three hundred movies).
.
Frankly ZeroNet, indeed, **the world** needs more people courageous enough to steam into any thread and start calling people "brainless" and "jerk" and telling them to "stfu" (and not meekly hold back from that just because the other people were simply **tricky** enough not to do it first.) And to take that war into other unrelated threads involving people who've got nothing to do with it. And do it all secure in the knowledge that it's all the other person's fault for their stupidity and their awfulness toward you and they're just getting what they deserve: **TRUTH**!
.
You've been doing it in threads long before I came onto ZeroNet. You've been doing it regularly while I've been on ZeroNet. And you'll be doing it long after I'm probably gone from ZeroNet. **Keep it up and stay strong!**
.
Poor, brave Krixano / KxoBot / whatever other name you're using beginning with a K.
.
.
Wait a minute... *my* name begins with a K.
Whoa! Am I in some ZeroNet version of *Fight Club*???

@Eightyfour: Just wait till I use my mad haxxor skillz to doxx the f### out of you!
.
Here it comes: using big data analysis, facial recognition on your avatar  (**big** mistake there, pal!) and other special secret 1337 techniques (DuckDuckGo) I have discovered:
+ Eightyfour's real name: **Eric Arthur Blair** (despite trying to hide behind yet more aliases! You can't trick me!)
+ Eightyfour's home address: [22 Portobello Road](https://www.rbkc.gov.uk/subsites/visitkensingtonandchelsea/seedo/people/blueplaques/recordsl-o/georgeorwell.aspx), Notting Hill, London W11 3DH. [Full deets and even internal pics here](https://www.zoopla.co.uk/property/22-portobello-road/london/w11-3dh/25141544)

Tor and ZeroNet cannot hide you from my skillz!!!1!

@caryoscelus: 
> am i supposed to thank you for bravely admitting to being a jerk?! Did you just try to evade the justice by admitting your transgressions?
> Oh, what sort of people did the indulgence culture bring upon us!
Yeah, I did just do that. Shouldn't I get a trophy or something?
@Eightyfour: :D :D :D

@Krixanoschool2:
Thank you for the comprehensive list! Some wouldn't have had the courage to get semantic over the exact quantities, frequencies (every vs often) & adjectives (*shitty* vs *jerk*) in the obvious parody. But you did. Another devastating takedown!

As for pain, well it's just the result of truth. And you bring the truth!

One quibble though:
> Quote one line where I attack a persons family or call someone an animal.
You mean from the comedy insult I directed at eightyfour? Whooosh!
---
But please, if you don't want me to say any more, just tell me to shut the fuck up again, like I did... wait, like *you* did in what had been a perfectly civil thread. This time I might obey. Although I wouldn't bet on it.

> This isn't a cop out... It's called giving someone the whole information and not telling them only some of the information - this is what ZeroNet is literally here to prevent.

You mean the hypothetical answer  that *I* composed showing how you could have just given an answer with useful information and not personal attacks, but didn't? Whoooosh!

> Oh... sorry. Didn't realize that more content couldn't be uploaded to these zites in the future.

Oh like the "hopefully will have more in the future" I included in said hypothetical answer? Whooooosh!

> What "takedown" are you actually talking about. The only zite you've used to my knowledge is KxoVid. Also, let's not lie about the fact that your data was deleted, because I've already been clear to people that it wasn't.

Do you not know what "takedown" means in the context of disagreement / conflict?

> Most people on here aren't native English speakers - you can't automatically assume the word "movies" to be specifically movies how native English speakers would call movies. I've seen people call videos movies. It's better to give too much information than not enough.

Oh well, then that clearly justifies making half your answer a personal attack on me for giving them a list of sites that actually have movies. You score!!!!

> Or do you mean when I said this after you kept continuing to tell me what to do and being condescending:
> Right... except I actually need to setup my dev environment - which takes more time than I'm willing to do when I have more important things, so not problem solved - so how about stfu.
All that came *after* the last comment I directed to you, so "you kept continuing" seems an odd way to phrase.

> You can't mean longer than 2 years right... because I've only been on for 2 years.
Wow! You're right, I *didn't* mean longer than 2 years. You score!!!!!

> You know damn well I only have two names on here - and I certainly don't hide my real name either - you can literally see it on my GitHub.
` posted by @Krixanoschool2:`

@Krixanoschool2: 
> Oh... first you don't actually tell anyone who you're specifically talking about, and then you have the audacity to blame me for that?
You mean in my comment on eightyfour's post where I consistently address him/her with the second person "you" before you (krixanoschool2, better make that clear) ever showed up in the thread?
My bad!

@Krixanoschool2: > And what was the "personal attack" again?

Quoted right there a few centimetres down the page as well as linked to in my first comment, but as you need is yet again:
> of course, klu9 already knew that, but chose not to tell you this (which is a deliberate disservice to you, imo - but of course he probably didn't like that I told him off for being a jerk, lol)

> Do you know how to not speak ambiguously?
You mean words that literally only have one definition in the dictionary? I might make the effort just for you. Oops, "just" can be both an adjective and an adverb.

@Krixanoschool2: So you don't think calling people "jerk", "brainless" and telling them to "shut the fuck up", then *literally following them into other threads and keeping up that kind of shit there* is harassment, right? And then, on top of it, claiming victimhood and demanding empathy after behaving like that? But of course, in your mind, that's not what you did. Hence the parody of your constant "I'm not the perpetrator, I'm the *victim*" routine.

@Krixanoschool2: Ah, so that was **me** coming into [a thread](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/1Fnk5S9aU2kCvTFtYMWosbE9NFaRjgeemo/1555930698) **you** were participating in and behaving like that?
Or was it [a thread](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1White24UrrwQrD86o6Vrc1apgZ1x1o51/13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE/1554823066) literally addressed to **you** that **I** came into and started throwing "jerk", "brainless" and "shut the fuck up" at **you**?
Gonna (oops, "I'm going to") take a break to eat. You might want to save your next devastating takedowns (you know what I mean now by that, right?) for later.

@Desenhoeanime: You're welcome.

So the developer has made this because "traditional" SinglePage files don't work in some browsers? Anybody know which? The files work in every browser I've tried. (Vivaldi, Firefox, Chrome, K-Meleon, IE)
.
Of course, given [the type of content I'm saving to ZeroNet](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Papers8S7fe6LEsa7BwVVywWVbMpUjgwx/), what I'd *really* like is a fork of SingleFile that automatically converts massive JPGs into WEBPs with similar visual quality but smaller file size. :)

**The good news**: the file size is significantly smaller. E.g. today's [The Papers](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Papers8S7fe6LEsa7BwVVywWVbMpUjgwx/?Post:37:) regular SingleFile version is 4.0MB, but the SingleFileZ version is 2.5MB. A major improvement!

**The bad news**: when I click the link I get:
> Error: cannot read the zip file. If you are using a chromium-based browser and trying to read the page from the filesystem, it must be started with the switch '--allow-file-access-from-files'.

From the extension info, I thought this would only happen if trying to open the file via my file manager on my hard drive, but it happens when trying to open the online link via my browser. (Related to ZeroNet being localhost?) And it happens in both Vivaldi (Chromium-based) and Firefox too, despite the developer saying only Chromium-based browsers are affected.
.
As I doubt people are going to close their browser and restart it with that switch (if they even know how to) just to read one link, I think SingleFileZ is not a viable option for me. Pity :(

The bill's backers claim it has safeguards against being used by the CCP-PRC to grab people for political purposes, saying that it will only apply to people charged with serious non-political crimes carrying sentences of seven years or more.
.
So you can bet there will be a noticeable increase in the number of dissidents, journalists etc suddenly being charged with previously unheard-of hit-and-run accidents (like [Gui Minhai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gui_Minhai#Confirmation_of_detention), the publisher kidnapped from Thailand), major tax evasion, and drug trafficking (like [Ivan Golunov](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-48566028) ).
